channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023111289
item.description:
Report X-2023111289

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-18
  • City: LANDOVER
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE CAME DOWN SLIDE TO "PULL" BAY. LOADER REPORTED TO BELT SUPERVISOR AND CONTACTED RESPONDERS. PULLED TRUCK OUT OF LINE-UP FOR FRESH AIR. RESPONDER, WITH HIS PPE(BOOTS,APRONS,GOGGLE,GLOVES), SPILL CART, AND WEARING REFLECTIVE VEST, RESPOND TO YARD PARKED TRUCK WITH DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. CONTAINERIZED WITH CLAY INTO SPILL TRAY. CORDON OFF WITH CAUTION TAPE W/4 ORANGE CONE,50 FEET FROM WATER SOURCE. PAPER TOWEL WIPED OFF TRUCK SHELF. CALLED FOR OUTSIDE RESPONDERS.

item.title: Report X-2023110752
item.description:
Report X-2023110752

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: discovered damaged on work area 1137.outer container was wet.upon inspection no internal partition.2 of the bottles had loose caps leaking out approx 15 oz of content total. DescribePack: failure was due to lack of a internal partition causing two bottles to have loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: loose absorb was used to address spill.package was placed in hazmat tote and put under ventilation system.

item.title: Report X-2023110893
item.description:
Report X-2023110893

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: BELTSVILLE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found the damage package in damage hazmat cage. The packaging was ripped and torn. I repacked the hazmat in a salvage drum and completed the required reports. DescribePack: One of the inner containers had a loose cap which resulted in a spill. About one quart of content leaked onto the other container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet box was placed in a tub and taken to the damage hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS SENT THROUGH THE OVERHEAD SORTATION BELTS. DescribePack: THE CAPS CAME OFF 2 OF THE PLASTIC JUGS CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT AND COAT THE OTHER JUGS IN THE PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING. LOOSE ABSORB WAS USED IN THE CLEAN UP.
